document.docTitle: Iphiplateia jakei Coleman & Lowry, 2012, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Iphiplateia (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Phliantidae) from Australia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Iphiplateia (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Phliantidae) from Australia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material studied.
Holotype , male?, 4 mm . NMV
J 20887
.

Type locality.
Port Phillip Bay, Point Lonsdale, Pier, Victoria, Australia , (
38 ° 18 'S
144 ° 37 'E
), 1 m depth; red and green algae, hand/snorkel, leg. G.C.B. Poore,
25 February 1991
, Stn CRUST 106 .

Additional material examined.
1 male
, 2.1 mm , NMV
J 59358
, Western Port, off Crib Point, Victoria, Australia (
38 ° 19 ' 59 ''S
145 ° 15 '08''E
), FV
Melita
, 2 m depth, leg. A.J. Gilmor, Smith-McIntyre grab,
16 March 1965
, CPBS-N 12 ;
1 specimen
, unknown sex, 2.2 mm , NMV J 60904 , 2 km SE of Point Nepean; Victoria, Australia (
38 ° 19 ' 49 ''S
144 ° 39 ' 56 ''E
), 12 m depth, leg. T.D. O'Hara & S.P. Heislers, airlift,
17 May 1996
, VNPMS 89 4 ;
1 specimen
, unknown sex, 2.2 mm , NMV
J 59359
, Western Port, off Crib Point, Victoria, Australia (
38 ° 22 ' 17 ''S
145 ° 13 ' 25 ''E
), FV
Melita
, 3 m depth, leg. A.J. Gilmor, Smith-McIntyre grab,
16 March 1965
, CPBS-N 02;
1 juvenile
, 1.1 mm , NMV
J 59352
, Nepean Bay, Point Nepean,Victoria, Australia (
38 ° 18 ' 24 ''S
144 ° 39 ' 28 ''E
), 5–6 m depth; leg. T.D. O' Hara & Plummer, Quadrat/ SCUBA ,
8 April 1998
–
25 May 1998
, WV 8 .
Etymology. This species is named for Jake Willcox, the dear son in law of the senior author.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Morphological differences between
Iphiplateia jakei
sp. nov.
and
Iphiplateia verenaae
sp. nov.
.

tr.td: distolateral lobe almost as long as disto medial lobe, folded dorsally
with medial lobe only, which reaches distal margin of 3rd article
with medial lobe, shorter than distal margin of 3rd article and additional dorsolateral lobe

subSubSection.paragraph: d e f g
h b

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 9a–h.
Iphiplateia jakei
sp. nov.
, holotype, male?, 4 mm: NMV J 20887. a) habitus, aesthetascs omitted; b) antenna 1; c) antenna 2; d) left mandible; e) right mandible; f) lower lip; g) upper lip; h) dorsal keel, left aspect. Scale bars: a, h) 1 mm; b, c, g) 200 µm; d, e, f) 50 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: a
c d e a

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 10a–e.
Iphiplateia jakei
sp. nov.
, holotype, male?, 4 mm: NMV J 20887. a) maxilla 1; b) maxilla 2; c) maxilliped, only left side illustrated, anterior aspect; d) pereopod 1, setation of carpus to dactylus not illustrated; e) pereopod 1 detail of carpus to dactylus. Scale bars: a, b) 100 µm; c–e) 200 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: b c e d
f a

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11a–f.
Iphiplateia jakei
sp. nov.
, holotype, male?, 4 mm: NMV J 20887. a) pereopod 2; b) pereopod 3; c) pleopod 1; d) pereopod 4; e) pleopod 3, inner lobe damaged; f) pleopod 2. Scale bars: a-f) 200 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: b c

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 12a–f.
Iphiplateia jakei
sp. nov.
, holotype, male?, 4 mm: NMV J 20887. a) pereopod 5; b) pereopod 6; c) pereopod 7; d) uropod 3; e) uropod 1; f) uropod 2. Scale bars: a–f) 200 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variability. There is some variability in the height of the dorsal keel and the length of the coxal plates.

Remarks. For differences between
I. jakei
sp. nov.
and the similar
I. verenaae
sp. nov.
see
Table 2
.
Distribution. Victoria, Australia .
